title: Lee Selby wrestled away from confronting Ricky Burns after late punch
text:
Burns hit Selby well after the bell rang (Picture: Reuters)

Lee Selby had to be held back by the referee after Ricky Burns clocked the Welshman after the bell during their clash in London.

Neither man could afford to lose the domestic dust-up at the O2 Arena, with Burns turning 37-years-old next April and Selby trying to rebuild his boxing career at lightweight.

Selby raced into a big lead in the first four rounds on his way to a points victory as Burns struggled to get on the inside of the former featherweight world champion.

Burns was also growing increasingly frustrated with Selby, repeatedly telling the referee to watch for his opponent hitting him behind the head and in the clinch.

Selby was doing well to frustrate Burns (Picture: Reuters)

It appeared Selby’s tactics eventually told on Burns after he had been caught by two painful left hooks in quick succession.

Burns reacted angrily at the end fifth round, at what he deemed a late punch and smacked Selby well after the bell had rang.

Selby was furious with the punch and the referee had to wrestle him away from confronting Burns. The Welshman eventually calmed down and returned to his corner, but not before he made his point to the referee.

Burns escaped with a verbal warning, but the dirty boxing continued throughout the fight, much to the annoyance of the Scotsman.

Selby eased to a points victory (Picture: Reuters)

Burns’ complaints eventually got the crowd on side as a blow round the back of the head from Selby drew loud boos.

The altercation mid-way through the fight didn’t stop either man from congratulating each other at the final bell, however.

Selby was confirmed the winner by the judges, 115-115, 116-112 and 116-113, and insisted after the fight his goal was to become Wales’ first two-weight champion.

description: Ricky Burns almost sparked a melee with Lee Selby after the fifth round bell when he smacked the Welshman with a late blow.
